story.text: __Many Voices__ is a project to create an intoxicating platform for visual and non-written languages. We focus in particular (but not exclusively) on sign language, and indigenous languages, and together create an audiovisual landscape of diverse language modalities. All voices welcome.

> Note: my interest is in creating or helping to create a space which is governed and structured by others. I am interested myself in experimenting with non-verbal communication as an art practice, and in abstractions around the concept of diversity. I look to meet others with a similar passion.

One grounded path to build community is to work with the Wikipedia community around translation. This community effort needs strengthening, and we might be able to add an element of video using Wikimedia Commons.

Note: I see the path to this through creating partnerships. Discussions with a language schools looks promising. I am proposing creating a WCS [[Study Circle]] for this project and organising a series of workshops.

# Roadmap
In the case of translation it would be something like:

1) Convene a group with energy around translation issues. In this case the "Speaking in Tongues" proto- group  described earlier with deaf community, software developers, and indigenous language

2) Run a time limited set of workshops with the group. Explore software tools, build community, look for funding in the course / workshops

3) Award a WCS Certificate in "Translation / Diversity" and require participants to pay back their learning by teaching what they have leraned or by other ways of supporting WCS.
